snippet: A drop in unemployment in January, the fifth straight monthly decline, suggested an 8.9 percent forecast was too high.
abstract: Advisers to Pres Obama, drawing on a string of improved economic data, update their forecasts to project that the economy will create two million jobs in 2012 if stimulus measures are extended, which could reduce unemployment to about 8 percent by year's end.
lead_paragraph: A drop in unemployment in January, the fifth straight monthly decline, suggested an 8.9 percent forecast was too high.

headline.seo: Obama Economic Advisers Raise Job Creation Forecast
headline.main: Obama Advisers Offer Rosier Jobs Outlook
headline.print_headline: Obama Advisers Raise Forecast for Job Creation
